etymology.description: 一(一) (yī, "one; single") + 样(樣) (yàng, "appearance; kind") = having the same appearance or kind, thus 'same' or 'alike'.
etymology.interpretation: It makes sense to use 一(一) (yī, "one") to imply singularity or uniformity, combined with 样(樣) (yàng, "appearance") to denote having a unified appearance or type, thereby meaning 'same'.

examples.chinese: 我们的衣服一样(我們的衣服一樣)。
这件衬衫和那件衬衫一样(這件襯衫和那件襯衫一樣)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn chènshān hé nà jiàn chènshān yīyàng.
examples.english: This shirt and that shirt are the same.

examples.chinese: 我们的观点一样(我們的觀點一樣)，追求的目标相同(追求的目標相同)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen de guāndiǎn yīyàng, zhuīqiú de mùbiāo xiāngtóng.
examples.english: Our perspectives are the same, and the goals we pursue are identical.
